transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Well, hello there, this is Tansut. Welcome to Space Ghost Coast to Coast. Tonight, funny man Bob Odenkirk, and his partner in fun, David Cross. Mmmmomma! Mmmomma, get in the cellar! Close all the shutters and chain down the cows! There's a comedy twister comin'! Here's Spaaace Ghooost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, earth people, and welcome to a show from outer space! (last word echoes) I'm Space Ghost. Joining me tonight are comedians David Cross and Bob Odenkirk. Moltar, I hear we have an extra special feature for the audience tonight.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Are you referring to the "Space Time Quiz Fun 9000"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not lying when I say I'm really excited about this new feature. But we'll save that for later in the show. Let's get to know our contestants, shall we?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk; David and Bob are on the monitor as it lowers) Welcome to the show, citizens.

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Thank you very much. Mr. Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Is it, what, is it Mr. Ghost, or can we just call you Space?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The Native Americans call me "Broken wind clap like thunder".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But you may call me Mr. Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, which of you is which?

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, I'm David Cross... (points at himself)

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: And I'm Bob Odenkirk. Did I say my name right?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: God, it's a tough name to say.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How long have you had it?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: I just got it. Uh, Bob Odenkirk.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: But you know how I said it, I said "Baa Bodenkirk".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't worry about it, Baa. Moltar can fix it in the edit.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Moltar. I, just cut that out for me, will ya? Thanks, pal.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ever been interviewed by a cartoon superhero before?

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Uh, this is my fifth, si- no, never.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: And I have never, ever, this is a real treat for me, and I've never even been to outer space before this. Unless you count some, uh, parties that I had in college. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I know what you mean. At superhero night school, we once had a mixer that lasted until ten PM.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh no, not the night school story!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I had fourteen cups of ginger ale, and wet my...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What, I wet my pants. I'm not ashamed, I was young.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was quite the cut-up. I bet you two were class clowns.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: I, David was a class clown, I used to just laugh at him.

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: But I was literally a clown, I used to come in to school with the grease paint, the wig, and the floppy shoes, and a (makes "horn honk" hand gesture & sound).

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, sad, and I would go (sad voice) "Did somebody order a clown?"

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: I have the power to tell when people are in trouble, very far away, up to, like, twenty miles away. But I don't have any other powers, so I have to run, or get a cab, or...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's weak. Baa, how about you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is that it? Those are measly little sissy powers! I save entire planets.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: God bless you, man. If we could, we would, but all we can do is make one or two people giggle a little bit.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And those one or two people will be giggling their way to Armageddon while you two jokers do your little "ha ha" act!!

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: (stunned silence, then laughs) What could I do? You invited me on this show!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aims his power bands at monitor) Alright, hunker down!

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, uh, Zorak, what is the story here?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, when has that stopped ya?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Go ahead, let him blast ya. It's really not that bad.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm. Whattya say, give me a laser shot? Take me out?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It kinda stings, are you sure?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Take me out right in the face, middle of the face.

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: I don't want it, what do I gotta do?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: (yells, then gasps) Oh, holy, ho, gigi! Alright, one more.

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Do I, do I want one of these?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: I don't know, if you like to feel good, I don't know, you tell me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah well, to heck with the glasses, one for you. (blasts Dave)

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Ow, no, I said no, I said no, please!

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Oh, mmm, it clears the sinuses.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: I can breathe. I can breathe for the first time in my life, and (sniff sniff) (to David) you stink!

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Well, I can't breathe! (talking with stuffed nose) You gave him my clear sinuses.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: And I have the brain of a chicken now!

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: You gave him my brain of a chicken!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And there's a swarm of bees flying around in my stomach.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, I mean it! They're stingin' my insides! Ow, ow ow, ow! (walks away from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah, tell me, fellas, what makes you laugh?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: People fall down. Big people fall down.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Adult people fall down. That make me funny. Laugh. Ha ha.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So you're telling me if I walked over across the set, and fell down...

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Would you do it for us?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Would you do it for us, but act like you're not gonna, act real confident, and then fall down.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (off camera) (hums, then noise of him tripping, yelling, and falling down)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laying on floor in front of his desk)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still laying there, pain in his voice) Uh, yes, yes I did. Did, did you like it?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Yeah! And this time, run across the floor with some scissors!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah! And, and put a bunch of pencils in your mouth.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know... Sounds kinda dangerous.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You think it would be, but it's not.

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: You know my motto, "If it hurts, do it."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, okay. Zorak, help me up. Moltar, bring the scissors out here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dave, are you talkin' to Zorak?

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Well, yeah, Zorak and I used to hang in public high school.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I pants'ed him in gym class.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're lying! Zorak never went to school! I've got records on him since birth, and Zorak has never...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) We're back with David Cross and Baa Bodenkirk. So now, which of you is the straight man, and which of you is the wacky sidekick?

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: Uh, he's straight, and I'm gay. Wait! What did you ask?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said, which of you is the straight man, and which of you is the wacky sidekick?

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: You're talking about, oh, comedy. Oh, shoot.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course I am! (buzz!) What was that, are the muffins ready?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, you idiot, it's time for the stupid game show segment!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're right, Moltar. (game show theme music in background) It's time for (echo effect) Space Quiz Time Fun 9000. (his face is framed with marquee lights and the words "SPACE TIME QUIZ FUN 9000") With your host, Space Ghost. (music finishes; his smile sparkles) I ask you a question, but be careful. If you get it wrong, you get blasted. If you get it right... you get blasted.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ready, guys? (cheezy organ music plays in background, with timer ticking; Dave and Bob confer; bell rings)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I haven't asked you a question yet. (music & timer start again, Dave and Bob confer; bell rings)

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Next, uh, Mama's homemade recipes, for 300.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mama's homemade recipes for 300 it is. What is the main ingredient in my mom's delicious cheeseburger pie? (music & timer start again, Dave and Bob confer; bell rings)

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: (yells) Ah, man, you get addicted to that, you know what I mean?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, I have a tattoo. What is it of, and where is it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I got it in Panama City over spring break. Spring break, whoo! (burp!) Ooh, pardon me. You guys wanna see it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hang on a minute... (Space Ghost is off-camera; unzipping sound, with grunts and groans)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (showing an indeterminate part of his body to Dave and Bob) It's a cute little panda, swinging from a branch.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Put the suit back on, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (puts his suit back on; cheesy organ music starts up again) Boys, we're out of time, thanks for stopping by.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, thank you, hit me!

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: (making echo sound effect with his hands) Spaaaace Ghoooost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You want one for the road?

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Hit me, one for the road.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, here it comes. (aims powerbands, Dave and Bob brace themselves; power bands never fire) Psych!

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: (puts his hands up) Oh, come on!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, now it's getting out of hand.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, come on! Come on, do me!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeow! (falls backward as ray blasts through control room monitor; he lands flat on his back) Oh yeah! That's the one!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes I am. Bob, one more?

transcript.speaker: David Cross
transcript.dialogue: I don't want this to end on a bad note.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: (gasping) Oh, I love you, I love you...

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: (still gasping) No, Ghostie. Spacey, I love ya. Do it again, what the...

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: Come on, my friend, (yells) I need it, I need to feel it, (yells) I'm gettin' a jolt, (yells)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (still laying on his back in control room) Oh, Ghostie. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: I love you, man, I'd do anything for you, man.

transcript.speaker: Bob Odenkirk
transcript.dialogue: What could I do? You invited me on this show!
